Body: Steven has 18 peaches. Jake has 12 fewer peaches than Steven who has 8 more peaches than Jill.
Question: How many peaches does Jill have?

Body: In Haley's class 11 are boys who love to play marbles. If Haley gives 9 marbles to each boy
Question: How many marbles did she have?

Body: Ed had 30 more marbles than Doug. Ed lost 21 of his marbles at the playground. If Ed had 91 marbles
Question: How many more marbles did Ed have than Doug then?

Body: A farmer had 105 green tomatoes and 71 red tomatoes in his garden. If he picked 137 tomatoes
Question: How many tomatoes are left?

Body: Lewis earns $ 21 every week during the 216 weeks of harvest. If he has to pay $ 702 tax
Question: How much money will have at the end of the harvest season?

Body: Nell collects baseball cards. She had 566 cards while Jeff had 234 cards. She gave some of her cards to Jeff and now has 535 cards left.
Question: How many cards does Jeff have now?

Body: Rebecca wants to split a collection of marbles into groups of 4. Rebecca has 10 eggs and 20 marbles.
Question: How many groups will be created?

Body: Matthew had 31 crackers. He has 23 crackers left after he gave equal numbers of crackers to his 5 friends.
Question: How many crackers did Matthew give to his friends?

Body: An industrial machine can make 6 shirts a minute. It worked for 5 minutes yesterday and for 12 minutes today.
Question: How many shirts did machine make today?

Body: Marco and his dad went strawberry picking. Marco's strawberries weighed 10 pounds. If together their strawberries weighed 26 pounds.
Question: How much more did his dad's strawberries weigh than his?
